bug.author: awsaf49
bug.summary: pycocotools unable to run: 'numpy.float64' object cannot be interpreted as an integer
bug.description: I was trying this <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/github/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/tutorial.ipynb>notebook</denchmark-link> on Microsoft Azure notebook instead of colab but got this error!! <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36858976/91635252-acf3e080-ea18-11ea-85d9-92be380c022b.PNG></denchmark-link>

comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/awsaf49>@awsaf49</denchmark-link> pycocotools problem in your environment. it appears you may have environment problems. Please ensure you meet all dependency requirements if you are attempting to run YOLOv5 locally. If in doubt, create a new virtual Python 3.8 environment, clone the latest repo (code changes daily), and pip install -r requirements.txt again. We also highly recommend using one of our verified environments below. <denchmark-h:h2>Requirements</denchmark-h>
or later with all <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/requirements.txt>requirements.txt</denchmark-link> dependencies installed, including . To install run: $ pip install -r requirements.txt <denchmark-h:h2>Environments</denchmark-h>
YOLOv5 may be run in any of the following up-to-date verified environments (with all dependencies including <denchmark-link:https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda>CUDA</denchmark-link> /<denchmark-link:https://developer.nvidia.com/cudnn>CUDNN</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://www.python.org/>Python</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://pytorch.org/>PyTorch</denchmark-link> preinstalled):
Google Colab Notebook with free GPU: Kaggle Notebook with free GPU: https://www.kaggle.com/ultralytics/yolov5 Google Cloud Deep Learning VM. See GCP Quickstart Guide Docker Image https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov5. See Docker Quickstart Guide
<denchmark-h:h2>Status</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/workflows/CI%20CPU%20testing/badge.svg></denchmark-link>
If this badge is green, all <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/actions>YOLOv5 GitHub Actions</denchmark-link> Continuous Integration (CI) tests are passing. These tests evaluate proper operation of basic YOLOv5 functionality, including training (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/train.py>train.py</denchmark-link> ), testing (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/test.py>test.py</denchmark-link> ), inference (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/detect.py>detect.py</denchmark-link> ) and export (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/models/export.py>export.py</denchmark-link> ) on MacOS, Windows, and Ubuntu.

@awsaf49 pycocotools problem in your environment. it appears you may have environment problems. Please ensure you meet all dependency requirements if you are attempting to run YOLOv5 locally. If in doubt, create a new virtual Python 3.8 environment, clone the latest repo (code changes daily), and pip install -r requirements.txt again. We also highly recommend using one of our verified environments below. Requirements Python 3.8 or later with all requirements.txt dependencies installed, including torch>=1.6. To install run: $ pip install -r requirements.txt Environments YOLOv5 may be run in any of the following up-to-date verified environments (with all dependencies including CUDA/CUDNN, Python and PyTorch preinstalled): * **Google Colab Notebook** with free GPU: [![Open In Colab](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/52feade06f2fecbf006889a904d221e6a730c194/68747470733a2f2f636f6c61622e72657365617263682e676f6f676c652e636f6d2f6173736574732f636f6c61622d62616467652e737667)](https://colab.research.google.com/github/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/tutorial.ipynb)
* **Kaggle Notebook** with free GPU: https://www.kaggle.com/ultralytics/yolov5
* **Google Cloud** Deep Learning VM. See [GCP Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/wiki/GCP-Quickstart)
* **Docker Image** https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov5. See [Docker Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/wiki/Docker-Quickstart) ![Docker Pulls](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/caa63570e9f4e9771b02fc86d87e78aad3bf9785/68747470733a2f2f696d672e736869656c64732e696f2f646f636b65722f70756c6c732f756c7472616c79746963732f796f6c6f76353f6c6f676f3d646f636b6572)
Status
If this badge is green, all YOLOv5 GitHub Actions Continuous Integration (CI) tests are passing. These tests evaluate proper operation of basic YOLOv5 functionality, including training (train.py), testing (test.py), inference (detect.py) and export (export.py) on MacOS, Windows, and Ubuntu.
Thanks for your quick response
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
